title: ATypI Vancouver city guide goes live
content:
The ATypI Vancouver team has launched the first phase of an extensive city guide for attendees at this year's conference. The site includes general information about the Vancouver area, photos, a transportation guide, and suggested activities for those who are planning a vacation around the conference or bringing their families. Information from the ATypI team is supplemented with a hand-picked selection of links.   
   
 [http://www.atypi.org/40\_conferences/28\_Vancouver/10\_venue](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020030156/http:/www.atypi.org/40_conferences/28_Vancouver/10_venue)   
   
In late-July, the guide will be updated with information about the two conference venues: the Westin Bayshore Resort & Marina (where the pre-conference technology workshop, the Thursday night reception and keynote address, and the Friday morning plenary session will take place), and Emily Carr Institute of Art + Design (where the remainder of the conference will happen).   
   
In mid-August, the guide will be updated again, with restaurant, bar and nightclub suggestions and maps.   
   
John Hudson   
ATypI 2003 programme planning committee   
 [www.atypi.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020030156/http:/www.atypi.org/)
author: John Hudson
